correct_nulls.py¶

correct_nulls.correct_nulls_all(data_df, method, x_df=None, y_df=None, drop_columns=False, threshold=0.3)¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame of data

  • method – A string representation of the method we are using to correct the nulls

  • x_df – A DataFrame of x values if it is a grid format

  • y_df – A DataFrame of y values if it is a grid format

  • drop_columns – A boolean of whether or not to drop column which have a certain amount of nulls in them

  • threshold – A threshold for what percentage of data values are null as to whether or not the column gets dropped

Returns

The corrected data as a DataFrame

Corrects the nulls in the data DataFrame in every column.

correct_nulls.correct_nulls_average(data_df, col_name)¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame of data

  • col_name – The name of the column we are interpolating or changing at the moment

Returns

The corrected data as a DataFrame

Corrects the nulls in the data DataFrame in the col_name column using the average of all of the values.

correct_nulls.correct_nulls_grid_interpolation(data_df, x_df, y_df, col_name)¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame of data

  • x_df – A DataFrame of x values

  • y_df – A DataFrame of y values

  • col_name – The name of the column we are interpolating or changing at the moment

Returns

The corrected data as a DataFrame

Corrects the nulls in the data DataFrame in the col_name column using interpolation. This data must conform to a grid format.

correct_nulls.correct_nulls_linear_remove(data_df)¶
Parameters

data_df – A DataFrame of data

Returns

The corrected data as a DataFrame

Corrects the nulls in the data DataFrame by removing any and all tuples which have nulls.
